text: The National Federation of Social Action (, FNAS) is a trade union representing social security workers in France. The union originated in 1955 as the National Autonomous and Interprofessional Syndicate of Inadapted Childhood. Initially independent, in 1972, it affiliated to Workers' Force, and reformed as the National Federation of Social Action. By 1995, it claimed 14,500 members. ==General Secretaries== :1972: François Kermoal :1983: Michel Pinaud :2005: Michel Paulini :2009: Pascal Corbex ==External links== * ==References== Category:Public sector trade unions Category:Trade unions established in 1972 Category:Trade unions in France
title: National Federation of Social Action
